display: can you give me a ballpark estimate of scope to build my own version of the TTS capabilities offered by services like ElevenLabs? i.e. time/LoE to build out an MVP of the agent service, as well as a rough estimate for cost to run the AI using my own API keys (Claude, ChatGPT, Gemini, or whatever else is best suited and cost effective)
can you provide a high-level scoping for Path A? I would prefer to use the lowest cost TTS provider, so perhaps Gemini?
why is this app trying to connect to metamask? (see the 'bun' terminal)
I'm running "bun dev" but don't see server requests from my client in the terminal. How can I enable this?
how do I define the Figma MCP (i.e. mcpServers) globally (i.e. user level) rather than project level in .claude.json?
add the GitKraken MCP server to my global settings in .claude.json
yes explain how to add a skill, using the file @.claude/skills/test-generator/SKILL.md as an example
yes troubleshoot why test-generator is not available

Review the website design at this Figma link: https://www.figma.com/design/7BO4GK2CwolnYpcUT28MiT/profile-page?node-id=9-131&t=sVKP7ZMSzTul8JkP-4\
\
Once you have reviewed the design I want you to think hard about how to implement this design. Then, create a comprehensive, developer-ready specification. Include all relevant requirements, architecture choices, data handling details, error handling strategies, and a testing plan so a developer can immediately begin implementation.\\
\
Contraint: Prefer to use the technology stack in the current repo (i.e. Tailwind, Shadcn, etc.). The spec should only propose adding new dependencies when absolutely necessary, and should include a clear explanation for why the existing stack cannot provide the functionality of the proposed dependency.
\
When you are done save the specification text to /Users/keenan/Repos/keenan/spec.md (i.e. the root of the 'keenan' repo).
to confirm, will the implementation of this spec support mobile AND desktop?
what do you mean by "mobile first" in this context?
what is the high level execution path when a user runs the Claude command "/plugin install <plugin-name>"?
this question is not related to this codebase, but rather about Claude Code's execution of the command "/plugin install <plugin-name>"
can you expand on the process involved for step 4 (integration)? specifically I want to know if there are any implicit actions (i.e. running scripts in the plugin's directories) that happen.
